data.title: Andrew Bronner
data.meta_description: Read all of the posts by Andrew Bronner on Worlds Of Country
data.text:
Author Archives: Andrew Bronner

Trey Duncan Drops Video for New Single, ‘Hotter Than Sin’

Forging a “country rock n’ soul” sound Trey Duncan’s fire filled artistry is on full display throughout his new single, Hotter Than Sin, as well as it’s accompanying music video. Shot by Emma Petty, the video is emblematic of Duncan’s personality and artistry, showing off Duncan’s fire and vision throughout. The steamy track focuses inContinue reading “Trey Duncan Drops Video for New Single, ‘Hotter Than Sin’”

6-Pack of Songs (September 14th)

Welcome back to our weekly feature where we count down and review our six favorite new singles from the past week! 6: Story to Tell, Maggie Baugh- Maggie Baugh has quite a Story to Tell and does so in marvelous fashion on her brand new single. Baugh embraces a YOLO, embrace life mindset as sheContinue reading “6-Pack of Songs (September 14th)”

Donice Morace Carves Out Timeless Sound with New Single ‘One Drink In’

There’s nothing quite like the early butterflies of new found infatuation, Donice Morace masterfully explores the incredibly real and relatable feeling on his brand new single, One Drink In. Drawing influences from traditional country legends like George Strait and Keith Whitley and a modern kick from the likes of Cody Johnson and Randall King, MoraceContinue reading “Donice Morace Carves Out Timeless Sound with New Single ‘One Drink In’”

Six Pack of Songs (August 24th)

Welcome back to our weekly feature where we count down and review our six favorite new singles from the past week! 6: I Can’t Unlove You, Lindsay James- There’s certain aspects of heartbreaking that are nearly impossible to escape. While moving on may not always be difficult, forgetting the love that was shared can oftenContinue reading “Six Pack of Songs (August 24th)”

Chris Andreucci Finds More Than Just ‘Strangers in A Bar’

You’ll find everyone in a bar, from the brokenhearted to the newly in love, and from friends catching up after not seeing each other in forever to strangers finding each other for the first time. Scottish Country artist and Nashville transplant, Chris Andreucci exquisitely explores all the happenings of a dive bar on his brandContinue reading “Chris Andreucci Finds More Than Just ‘Strangers in A Bar’”

Hunter Rae Says Goodbye to ‘Old Me’

The old Hunter can’t come to the phone right now…. It always feel good to find yourself after a prolonged of searching. Released from her constant need for people pleasing, Hunter Rae does exactly this on her new single, Old Me, an honest and articulate testament to Rae’s growth and newfound confidence. With a distinctContinue reading “Hunter Rae Says Goodbye to ‘Old Me’”

Exclusive: Go Behind The Scenes of Mitch Bradford’s New Album, “Close”

With an obvious 70’s theme, it’s fitting that Mitch Bradford recorded his latest album, Close, at the same studio where Fleetwood Mac recorded many of their hits. With a clearer vision of his artistic ethos, Bradford is extremely proud of his latest project and has given WoC exclusive behind the scenes photos from the recordingContinue reading “Exclusive: Go Behind The Scenes of Mitch Bradford’s New Album, “Close””

Six Pack of Songs (August 16th)

Welcome back to our weekly feature where we count down and review our six favorite new singles from the past week! 6: Kinda Don’t Ever, Anna Vaus- With her trademarked laid back delivery, and visceral lyrical punch, Anna Vaus continues to shine bright on her new single, Kinda Don’t Ever. Vaus reminisces on a pastContinue reading “Six Pack of Songs (August 16th)”

Greylan James Steps Into Spotlight For Debut EP, “I Hope She Hears These”

From it’s clever concept to it’s brilliant execution, Greylan James’ debut EP, I Hope She Hears These, is the perfect project for the brokenhearted, pining for a way back into the arms of their lost lover. Each of the project’s five tracks is akin to a figurative rock tossed lightly at the window of James’Continue reading “Greylan James Steps Into Spotlight For Debut EP, “I Hope She Hears These””
